metadata.source: Office of the Auditor General (OAG) Kenya
metadata.report_title: Report of the Auditor General on the Financial Statements of the National Government for FY 2023/2024

national_audit_findings.entity_name: National Treasury and Economic Planning
national_audit_findings.description: Accumulated pending bills of KES 589.7 billion remain unresolved across government ministries, departments and agencies, posing significant fiscal risk to ongoing service delivery
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: The National Treasury should develop a comprehensive pending bills clearance strategy with prioritized payment schedules

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Health
national_audit_findings.description: Irregular procurement of medical supplies worth KES 12.3 billion without competitive bidding, including COVID-19 related emergency purchases that lacked proper documentation
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Ministry should provide full documentation for emergency procurements and ensure future compliance with PPDA Act 2015

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Roads and Transport
national_audit_findings.description: Road construction project cost overruns totaling KES 47.8 billion across 23 major infrastructure projects, with some projects exceeding original estimates by over 200%
national_audit_findings.report_section: Ministry of Roads and Transport Vote
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Implement project cost management controls and conduct forensic audits on projects with overruns exceeding 50%

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Defence
national_audit_findings.description: Expenditure amounting to KES 8.7 billion classified under 'classified operations' lacked verifiable supporting documentation accessible to the Auditor General
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Establish secure audit arrangements for classified expenditure in line with Section 69 of the Public Finance Management Act

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Education
national_audit_findings.description: Grants to secondary schools and TVET institutions totaling KES 6.2 billion disbursed without adequate confirmation of receipt or utilization reports from beneficiary institutions
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Require mandatory utilization certificates before subsequent disbursements and conduct spot-check audits

national_audit_findings.entity_name: National Treasury and Economic Planning
national_audit_findings.description: National debt service costs rose to KES 1.17 trillion (62.8% of ordinary revenue), threatening fiscal sustainability. External debt refinancing losses from currency depreciation amounted to KES 234 billion
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Diversify debt portfolio towards longer-tenor concessional borrowing and establish hedging mechanisms for foreign currency exposure

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Interior and National Administration
national_audit_findings.description: Ghost workers and irregular payroll entries costing KES 3.4 billion identified across National Police Service and Kenya Prisons Service payrolls
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Conduct biometric verification of all uniformed services personnel and integrate IPPD with IPRS for real-time validation

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development
national_audit_findings.description: Fertilizer subsidy programme disbursed KES 9.1 billion with significant irregularities including payments to unregistered farmers and inflated pricing by contracted suppliers
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Digitize farmer registration and implement e-voucher system to prevent diversion of subsidized inputs

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Energy and Petroleum
national_audit_findings.description: Kenya Pipeline Company and National Oil Corporation revenue remittances to the Exchequer fell short by KES 4.6 billion against projected targets, with unreconciled pipeline throughput fees
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Automate revenue collection and remittance monitoring for all energy sector parastatals

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Water, Sanitation and Irrigation
national_audit_findings.description: 14 water and irrigation projects worth KES 28.3 billion remained stalled or behind schedule, with accumulated idle costs and contractor claims totaling KES 5.7 billion
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Establish project monitoring dashboards and enforce liquidated damages clauses for delayed contractors

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Information, Communications and the Digital Economy
national_audit_findings.description: Huduma Namba and Integrated National Management System projects exceeded budget by KES 7.2 billion with incomplete deliverables and vendor lock-in concerns
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Commission independent technology assessment and require open-standard compliance in all future ICT procurements

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Foreign and Diaspora Affairs
national_audit_findings.description: 64 diplomatic missions had unexplained expenditure variances of KES 2.1 billion, with 12 missions failing to submit accounts for the entire fiscal year
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Deploy unified financial management systems across all missions and require quarterly reporting compliance

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Lands, Public Works, Housing and Urban Development
national_audit_findings.description: Government immovable property register remains incomplete â€” an estimated 40% of government-owned land parcels worth approximately KES 1.2 trillion lack updated title documentation
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Fast-track the National Land Information Management System digitization and conduct nationwide verification of government properties

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Labour and Social Protection
national_audit_findings.description: Inua Jamii and cash transfer programmes had identified inclusion errors affecting 340,000 ineligible beneficiaries, with leakage estimated at KES 4.8 billion annually
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Implement biometric authentication for all social protection disbursements and conduct beneficiary re-registration

national_audit_findings.entity_name: The State Department for Correctional Services
national_audit_findings.description: Correctional facilities across the country have accumulated a maintenance backlog costing KES 1.8 billion, with 28 facilities rated as structurally compromised
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Develop a 5-year facility rehabilitation plan with allocated annual budget provisions

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Tourism and Wildlife
national_audit_findings.description: National parks and game reserves revenue collection shortfall of KES 3.2 billion due to outdated collection systems and unmonitored entry points
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Deploy electronic revenue collection at all park gates and automate reconciliation with KWS headquarters

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Youth Affairs, Sports and The Arts
national_audit_findings.description: Youth Enterprise Development Fund and Sports Fund disbursements totaling KES 2.9 billion lacked proper beneficiary verification and recovery mechanisms for non-performing loans
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Strengthen credit assessment processes and establish legal recovery framework for defaulting beneficiaries

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Environment, Climate Change and Forestry
national_audit_findings.description: National Climate Change Action Plan funds of KES 1.4 billion had low absorption rates (32%) with significant funds returned to Treasury unspent
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Build implementation capacity within the ministry and streamline climate fund disbursement procedures

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of East African Community, ASALs and Regional Development
national_audit_findings.description: ASAL development fund disbursements of KES 5.3 billion had inadequate monitoring and evaluation, with 60% of funded projects lacking completion reports
national_audit_findings.report_section: Ministry of EAC and ASALs Vote
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Establish integrated M&E framework and require project completion certificates before final payment tranches

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Mining, Blue Economy and Maritime Affairs
national_audit_findings.description: Mineral royalty collections fell short by KES 2.7 billion against estimated potential, with inadequate monitoring of mining operations and under-declared production volumes
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Deploy real-time production monitoring systems at major mining sites and strengthen royalty audit capacity

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Co-operatives and Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs)
national_audit_findings.description: Hustler Fund and MSME development fund disbursements of KES 8.4 billion had repayment rates below 40%, threatening fund sustainability
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Implement credit scoring for disbursements and integrate with CRB for defaulter tracking

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Ministry of Public Service, Gender and Affirmative Action
national_audit_findings.description: National Gender and Equality Commission programmes spent only KES 890 million of KES 2.1 billion allocation, with procurement delays and poor project implementation
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Conduct capacity assessment and develop quarterly expenditure targets with management accountability

national_audit_findings.entity_name: National Treasury and Economic Planning
national_audit_findings.description: The Integrated Financial Management Information System (IFMIS) had 847 override transactions worth KES 34.2 billion where standard controls were bypassed without adequate justification
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Review and restrict override privileges, implement real-time monitoring of override transactions, and require dual authorization for all overrides above KES 10M

national_audit_findings.entity_name: National Treasury and Economic Planning
national_audit_findings.description: Material differences of KES 156.8 billion between CBK records and National Treasury records for the Consolidated Fund remain unexplained as at end of FY 2023/24
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: Establish a dedicated reconciliation unit and complete monthly reconciliation with CBK within 30 days of period end

national_audit_findings.entity_name: Republic of Kenya
national_audit_findings.description: The Auditor General issued a qualified opinion on the National Government financial statements for FY 2023/24, citing material misstatements in pending bills, payroll, and asset registers across multiple ministries
national_audit_findings.recommended_action: All accounting officers should address audit queries within the statutory 60-day response window and implement previous audit recommendations

basis_for_qualification: Unexplained Consolidated Fund balance differences of KES 156.8 billion
Incomplete government property register affecting asset valuation
Unresolved pending bills of KES 589.7 billion
emphasis_of_matter: Debt service costs consuming 62.8% of ordinary revenue
Recurring nature of audit findings from previous years
